<a id="VisualShaderNodeColorOp"></a>

# VisualShaderNodeColorOp

**Inherits:** [VisualShaderNode](VisualShaderNode.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A [Color](Color.md) operator to be used within the visual shader graph.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Applies [operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#VisualShaderNodeColorOp_property_operator) to two color inputs.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **Operator**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator)

<a id="VisualShaderNodeColorOp_constant_OP_SCREEN"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator) **OP_SCREEN** = `0`

Produce a screen effect with the following formula:

```
    result = vec3(1.0) - (vec3(1.0) - a) * (vec3(1.0) - b);
```
<a id="VisualShaderNodeColorOp_constant_OP_DIFFERENCE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator) **OP_DIFFERENCE** = `1`

Produce a difference effect with the following formula:

```
    result = abs(a - b);
```
<a id="VisualShaderNodeColorOp_constant_OP_DARKEN"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator) **OP_DARKEN** = `2`

Produce a darken effect with the following formula:

```
    result = min(a, b);
```
<a id="VisualShaderNodeColorOp_constant_OP_LIGHTEN"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator) **OP_LIGHTEN** = `3`

Produce a lighten effect with the following formula:

```
    result = max(a, b);
```
<a id="VisualShaderNodeColorOp_constant_OP_OVERLAY"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator) **OP_OVERLAY** = `4`

Produce an overlay effect with the following formula:

```
    for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
        float base = a[i];
        float blend = b[i];
        if (base < 0.5) {
            result[i] = 2.0 * base * blend;
        } else {
            result[i] = 1.0 - 2.0 * (1.0 - blend) * (1.0 - base);
        }
    }
```
<a id="VisualShaderNodeColorOp_constant_OP_DODGE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator) **OP_DODGE** = `5`

Produce a dodge effect with the following formula:

```
    result = a / (vec3(1.0) - b);
```
<a id="VisualShaderNodeColorOp_constant_OP_BURN"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator) **OP_BURN** = `6`

Produce a burn effect with the following formula:

```
    result = vec3(1.0) - (vec3(1.0) - a) / b;
```
<a id="VisualShaderNodeColorOp_constant_OP_SOFT_LIGHT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator) **OP_SOFT_LIGHT** = `7`

Produce a soft light effect with the following formula:

```
    for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
        float base = a[i];
        float blend = b[i];
        if (base < 0.5) {
            result[i] = base * (blend + 0.5);
        } else {
            result[i] = 1.0 - (1.0 - base) * (1.0 - (blend - 0.5));
        }
    }
```
<a id="VisualShaderNodeColorOp_constant_OP_HARD_LIGHT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator) **OP_HARD_LIGHT** = `8`

Produce a hard light effect with the following formula:

```
    for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
        float base = a[i];
        float blend = b[i];
        if (base < 0.5) {
            result[i] = base * (2.0 * blend);
        } else {
            result[i] = 1.0 - (1.0 - base) * (1.0 - 2.0 * (blend - 0.5));
        }
    }
```
<a id="VisualShaderNodeColorOp_constant_OP_MAX"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator) **OP_MAX** = `9`

Represents the size of the [Operator](VisualShaderNodeColorOp.md#enum_VisualShaderNodeColorOp_Operator) enum.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>
